    • Method Detail

      • createNote

        public void createNote(Map<String,Object> params,
              ISirqulCallback<NoteResponse> callback)
        This is used to leave a comment (note) on a notable object (i.e. albums, album contests, assets, game levels, offers, offer locations, retailers, retailer locations, and theme descriptors). Leaving a comment on a notable object will be visiable to everyone who has access to view the object.

        Target API Endpoint: /note/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The unique accountId that made the request (either deviceId or accountId must be used)
        • SirqulKeys.notableType
          The notable object type {ALBUM, ALBUM_CONTEST, ASSET, GAME_LEVEL, OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER, RETAILER_LOCATION, THEME_DESCRIPTOR}
        • SirqulKeys.notableId
          The id of the notable object
        • SirqulKeys.comment
          The message the user wishes to leave a comment on
        • SirqulKeys.assetIds
          A comma separated list of asset IDs to add with the note
        • SirqulKeys.tags
          search tags
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableType
          This is used for sending out group notifications. For example, when someone adds a note to an asset which is also a part of an album, everyone in the album will receive a notification. This is achieved by passing in the permissionable type (in this case "album"), and the permissionable id (the album id). Possible types: {ALBUM, ALBUM_CONTEST, GAME_LEVEL, THEME_DESCRIPTOR}
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableId
          The id of the permissionable object (for sending group notifications)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key used to identify the application
        • SirqulKeys.locationDescription
          The description of the location
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of the user, maps to latitude and longitude

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        NoteResponse on success, SirqulResponse on failure
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NoteApiBase.createNote

      • deleteNote

        public void deleteNote(Map<String,Object> params,
              ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Sets a comment (note) as deleted.

        Target API Endpoint: /note/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The unique accountId that made the request (either deviceId or accountId must be used)
        • SirqulKeys.noteId
          The ID of the note to delete
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of the user, maps to latitude and longitude

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NoteApiBase.deleteNote

      • searchNotes

        public void searchNotes(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<NoteResponse>> callback)
        Search for notes on a notable object.

        Target API Endpoint: /note/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.notableType
          The notable object type {ALBUM, ALBUM_CONTEST, ASSET, GAME_LEVEL, OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER, RETAILER_LOCATION, THEME_DESCRIPTOR}
        • SirqulKeys.notableId
          The id of the notable object
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<NoteResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NoteApiBase.searchNotes

      • updateNote

        public void updateNote(Map<String,Object> params,
              ISirqulCallback<NoteResponse> callback)
        Update an existing comment (note). Only the creator of the note have permission to update.

        Target API Endpoint: /note/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The unique accountId that made the request (either deviceId or accountId must be used)
        • SirqulKeys.noteId
          The id of the note, used when editing a comment
        • SirqulKeys.comment
          The message the user wishes to leave a comment on
        • SirqulKeys.assetIds
          A list of asset IDs to add with the note
        • SirqulKeys.tags
          A list of search tags
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableType
          This is used for sending out group notifications. For example, when someone adds a note to an asset which is also a part of an album, everyone in the album will receive a notification. This is achieved by passing in the permissionable type (in this case "album"), and the permissionable id (the album id). Possible types: {ALBUM, ALBUM_CONTEST, GAME_LEVEL, THEME_DESCRIPTOR}
        • SirqulKeys.permissionableId
          The id of the permissionable object (for sending group notifications)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key used to identify the application
        • SirqulKeys.locationDescription
          The description of the location
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of the user, maps to latitude and longitude

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        NoteResponse on success, SirqulResponse on failure
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NoteApiBase.updateNote
